methodology: Systematic NAICS 4-digit (293 industries) and 6-digit (933 sub-industries) screening crossed with 8 structural forces. Web search validation on top opportunities.

signals.structural_force: Machine shops (NAICS 3327) have 338K employees across 21K establishments with $67K avg pay -- highly fragmented, moderate wages, prime acquire-and-modernize target
signals.headline: Machine shop sector: 21,372 establishments, high fragmentation, Silver Tsunami exposure
signals.detail: NAICS 3327 (Machine shops, turned products, screw/nut/bolt mfg) shows 338,702 employees across 21,372 establishments. Fragmentation proxy 0.063. Average pay $66,806. This is the CNC shop sector the engine has been tracking -- NAICS data confirms the structural opportunity. CloudNC already serving ~1,000 shops with AI CAM software; LimitlessCNC emerging from stealth.

signals.structural_force: Bakery/tortilla manufacturing (NAICS 3118) has 336K employees across 15,543 establishments -- specialty food acquisition confirmed viable
signals.headline: Bakery sector: 15,543 establishments, $48K avg pay, strong cobot integration potential
signals.detail: NAICS 3118 (Bakeries and tortilla manufacturing) shows 336,231 employees across 15,543 establishments. Average pay $48,236. Cobots proven in bakery ($20.35B food automation market by 2031). IBIE 2025 confirmed cobots + AR as practical for small/mid-size bakeries. Hybrid model (robots absorb repetitive, humans handle finishing) validated.

signals.structural_force: Architectural/structural metals manufacturing (NAICS 3323) has 407K employees across 16K establishments -- unexplored fabrication sector
signals.headline: Structural metals fabrication: 16,456 establishments, $69K avg pay, sheet metal + steel fab
signals.detail: NAICS 3323 (Architectural and structural metals manufacturing) shows 406,526 employees across 16,456 establishments. Average pay $69,101. Includes structural steel fabrication, plate work, and sheet metal work. Moderate fragmentation. Silver Tsunami exposure similar to CNC shops. AI-driven layout optimization + robotic welding = significant COGS compression.

signals.structural_force: Metalworking machinery manufacturing (NAICS 3335) has 161K employees across 7,771 establishments -- CNC machine BUILDER sector
signals.headline: Metalworking machinery: 7,771 establishments, $72K avg pay, builds the CNC machines themselves
signals.detail: NAICS 3335 (Metalworking machinery manufacturing) shows 161,187 employees across 7,771 establishments. Average pay $72,165. This is the sector that BUILDS CNC machines, lathes, milling machines. Fragmented with many small shops. AI opportunity: integrate AI into machine design and production, not just usage.

signals.structural_force: Plastics product manufacturing (NAICS 3261) has 600K employees across 12K establishments -- high automation potential, moderate wages
signals.headline: Plastics products: 12,048 establishments, $66K avg pay, injection molding + extrusion automation
signals.detail: NAICS 3261 (Plastics product manufacturing) shows 599,626 employees across 12,048 establishments. Average pay $65,996. Includes injection molding, blow molding, extrusion. Highly automatable with robotic part removal, AI quality inspection, predictive maintenance. Many small shops ripe for acquisition-modernization.

signals.structural_force: Printing industry (NAICS 3231) has 370K employees across 28K establishments -- highest fragmentation among manufacturing, 85% believe AI critical
signals.headline: Printing: 28,127 establishments, $59K avg pay, 85% say AI critical, declining employment
signals.detail: NAICS 3231 (Printing and related support) shows 369,822 employees across 28,127 establishments -- one of the most fragmented manufacturing sectors. Employment declining -6.1%. AI adoption jumped from 24.7% to 40%. 85% of print service providers believe AI is critical to competitiveness. Many retiring owners. Classic Silver Tsunami + AI modernization play.

signals.structural_force: Coating/engraving/heat treating (NAICS 3328) has 131K employees across 6,258 establishments -- highly specialized services manufacturing
signals.headline: Surface treatment: 6,258 establishments, $62K avg pay, AI quality control opportunity
signals.detail: NAICS 3328 shows 131,354 employees across 6,258 establishments. Average pay $62,009. Coating, engraving, heat treating, and allied activities. Highly specialized metal services sector. AI vision systems can dramatically improve quality control; process optimization via ML models reduces waste and energy.

signals.structural_force: Building equipment contractors (NAICS 2382) have 2.46M employees across 230K establishments -- massive workforce, 20%+ over 55, 499K new workers needed in 2026
signals.headline: HVAC/plumbing/electrical contractors: 2.46M employees, severe workforce shortage, 70% can't find workers
signals.detail: NAICS 2382 (Building equipment contractors -- HVAC, plumbing, electrical) shows 2,461,733 employees across 230,398 establishments. 70% of construction companies struggle to find workers. Nearly 20% of workforce over 55. Fortune reports 499,000 new workers needed in 2026. AI data centers specifically driving demand for electricians and HVAC techs. Google $10M grant for electrician training.

signals.structural_force: Home health care services (NAICS 6216) has 1.63M employees across 49K establishments -- aging population driving demand, AI monitoring emerging
signals.headline: Home health: 1.63M employees, $40K avg pay, Baumol candidate, AI care copilots launching
signals.detail: NAICS 6216 (Home health care services) shows 1,629,522 employees across 49,400 establishments. Average pay $39,780. Massive Baumol candidate at low-wage end. Sensi AI offers 24/7 care copilot. Healthcare AI spending tripled to $1.4B in 2025. 8 healthcare AI unicorns in 2025. Services for elderly (NAICS 624120) has 2.23M employees with even lower pay ($26,496) and extreme fragmentation.

signals.structural_force: Legal services (NAICS 5411) have 1.18M employees across 207K establishments -- baumol_score 1.72, high fragmentation, moderate wage growth
signals.headline: Legal services: 207K establishments, $125K avg pay, 3.8% wage growth, highly fragmented
signals.detail: NAICS 5411 (Legal services) shows 1,181,363 employees across 207,408 establishments. Baumol score 1.72. Average pay $124,642 with 3.8% wage growth. Highly fragmented (frag proxy 0.176). Employment barely growing (+0.5%). Classic Baumol cure candidate with stored above-CPI energy releasing. $147B total wage base.

signals.structural_force: Accounting/bookkeeping (NAICS 5412) has 1.15M employees across 180K establishments -- baumol_score 1.30, core engine target confirmed
signals.headline: Accounting sector: 180K establishments, $95K avg pay, 2.9% wage growth, high fragmentation
signals.detail: NAICS 5412 (Accounting, tax prep, bookkeeping, payroll) shows 1,153,528 employees across 179,997 establishments. Baumol score 1.30. Average pay $94,570 with 2.9% wage growth. Very high fragmentation (frag proxy 0.156). Employment growing (+3.0%). $109B total wage base. Confirms core engine thesis.

signals.structural_force: Insurance agencies/brokerages (NAICS 5242) have 1.35M employees across 187K establishments -- baumol_score 1.35, 4.7% wage growth
signals.headline: Insurance intermediaries: 187K establishments, $98K avg pay, 4.7% wage growth
signals.detail: NAICS 5242 (Insurance agencies, brokerages) shows 1,350,177 employees across 186,691 establishments. Baumol score 1.35. Average pay $98,181 with strong 4.7% wage growth. Employment growing 4.4%. $132.6B total wage base. Stored Baumol energy growing with above-CPI wage increases.

signals.structural_force: Management consulting (NAICS 5416) has 1.85M employees across 395K establishments -- baumol_score 1.61, extremely fragmented
signals.headline: Management consulting: 395K establishments, $117K avg pay, highest fragmentation in professional services
signals.detail: NAICS 5416 (Management, scientific, technical consulting) shows 1,853,227 employees across 395,324 establishments. Baumol score 1.61. Average pay $116,563. Extremely fragmented (frag proxy 0.213). $216B total wage base -- one of the largest addressable pools. AI agents can handle many consulting deliverables.

signals.structural_force: Architectural/engineering services (NAICS 5413) have 1.65M employees across 167K establishments -- baumol_score 1.51, 4.3% wage growth
signals.headline: Architecture/engineering: 167K establishments, $109K avg pay, 4.3% wage growth, AI design tools emerging
signals.detail: NAICS 5413 (Architectural, engineering, related services) shows 1,654,591 employees across 166,975 establishments. Baumol score 1.51. Average pay $109,405 with strong 4.3% wage growth. Employment growing 3.4%. $181B total wage base. AI is already transforming architectural design and engineering calculations.

signals.structural_force: Advertising/PR (NAICS 5418) has 496K employees across 78K establishments -- baumol_score 1.44, AI content generation disrupting
signals.headline: Advertising/PR: 78K establishments, $104K avg pay, generative AI transforming creative workflows
signals.detail: NAICS 5418 (Advertising, public relations) shows 496,147 employees across 78,196 establishments. Baumol score 1.44. Average pay $104,291. Moderate fragmentation. Nearly flat employment. $51.7B total wages. Generative AI is already disrupting creative workflows -- 60% of printers planning AI for marketing design.

signals.structural_force: Offices of dentists (NAICS 6212) have 1.03M employees across 135K establishments -- Silver Tsunami + Baumol in dental sector
signals.headline: Dental offices: 135K establishments, $63K avg pay, 4.4% wage growth, PE rollup active
signals.detail: NAICS 6212 (Offices of dentists) shows 1,026,380 employees across 135,236 establishments. Average pay $62,938 with 4.4% wage growth. 137 PE add-on acquisitions in dental in 2024 alone. Many independent practices facing succession challenges. AI billing + scheduling + imaging analysis can reduce admin burden significantly.

signals.structural_force: Offices of other health practitioners (NAICS 6213) have 1.16M employees across 191K establishments -- chiropractors, optometrists, PTs, extremely fragmented
signals.headline: Allied health practices: 191K establishments, $51K avg pay, 6.8% employment growth, highest fragmentation in healthcare
signals.detail: NAICS 6213 (Offices of other health practitioners) includes chiropractors, optometrists, physical therapists, speech therapists, podiatrists. 1,158,452 employees across 191,226 establishments. Extremely fragmented (frag proxy 0.165). Fast employment growth (6.8%). These small practices are largely underserved by enterprise healthcare IT. Full-service billing + scheduling + documentation = massive opportunity.

signals.structural_force: Veterinary industry PE rollups vulnerable -- many attractive practices already acquired, remaining targets have rising valuations, regulatory scrutiny increasing
signals.headline: Veterinary PE rollup vulnerability: saturation + margin compression + AI disruption potential
signals.detail: PE firms have aggressively rolled up veterinary practices but are now facing saturation (most attractive practices acquired), rising valuations on remaining targets, and emerging regulatory scrutiny. Simultaneously, AI veterinary tools (Digitail, Shepherd, CoVet) are reducing operational costs. 30% of vets already using AI daily/weekly. Creates arbitrage opportunity: acquire PE-distressed vet practices at depressed multiples.

signals.structural_force: Depository credit intermediation (NAICS 5221) has 1.79M employees across 107K establishments -- banking labor force ripe for AI transformation
signals.headline: Banking: 1.79M employees, $105K avg pay, baumol 1.45, moderate wage growth 3.3%
signals.detail: NAICS 5221 (Depository credit intermediation -- commercial banking, savings institutions, credit unions) shows 1,792,281 employees. Baumol score 1.45. $188.3B total wages. Many routine-cognitive tasks in loan processing, compliance, customer service. Community banks (107K establishments) particularly vulnerable to AI automation from larger institutions.

signals.structural_force: Fruit/vegetable preserving and specialty food (NAICS 3114) has 176K employees across 2,774 establishments -- specialty food production hub
signals.headline: Specialty food manufacturing: 2,774 establishments, $62K avg pay, FSMA 204 traceability moat
signals.detail: NAICS 3114 (Fruit and vegetable preserving and specialty food) shows 175,563 employees across 2,774 establishments. Average pay $62,009. Includes frozen food, canning, specialty food items. FSMA 204 traceability requirements creating compliance burden that becomes moat for tech-enabled producers. AI-driven QC, yield optimization, and predictive maintenance proven ROI.

signals.structural_force: Beverage manufacturing (NAICS 3121) has 325K employees across 16K establishments -- craft beverage boom, high fragmentation for beverages
signals.headline: Beverage manufacturing: 16,053 establishments, $58K avg pay, craft brewery/distillery boom
signals.detail: NAICS 3121 (Beverage manufacturing) shows 324,910 employees across 16,053 establishments. Includes breweries, wineries, distilleries, soft drink mfg. High establishment count driven by craft beverage boom. Many small operators with succession planning gaps. AI can optimize fermentation, QC, inventory management, and distribution scheduling.

signals.structural_force: Medical equipment/supplies manufacturing (NAICS 3391) has 331K employees across 14K establishments -- regulated production, AI QC potential
signals.headline: Medical device manufacturing: 14,031 establishments, $87K avg pay, FDA compliance moat
signals.detail: NAICS 3391 (Medical equipment and supplies manufacturing) shows 330,907 employees across 14,031 establishments. Average pay $87,250. FDA regulated manufacturing creates compliance moat. AI vision for defect detection, predictive maintenance for cleanroom equipment, and ML-driven process optimization. Many small device manufacturers ripe for modernization.

signals.structural_force: Specialized design services (NAICS 5414) have 152K employees across 47,660 establishments -- extremely fragmented, AI design tools disrupting
signals.headline: Design services: 47,660 establishments, $85K avg pay, highest fragmentation ratio in professional services
signals.detail: NAICS 5414 (Specialized design services -- interior, industrial, graphic, other) shows 151,824 employees across 47,660 establishments. Fragmentation proxy 0.314 -- the HIGHEST among professional services. Baumol score 1.17. Many solo practitioners and tiny firms. AI design tools (Midjourney, DALL-E, Figma AI) are compressing creative costs dramatically.

signals.structural_force: General freight trucking (NAICS 4841) has 1.1M employees across 127K establishments -- declining employment, AI dispatching/routing revolution
signals.headline: Freight trucking: 127K establishments, $66K avg pay, employment declining -1.1%, AI dispatch emerging
signals.detail: NAICS 4841 (General freight trucking) shows 1,095,187 employees across 126,670 establishments. Employment declining (-1.1%). Moderate fragmentation. AI dispatching, route optimization, and load matching startups proliferating (Fleetline, Lanesurf, Vorto, Oway). Q1 2026: $2.26B in robotics/logistics funding. The combination of driver shortage + AI dispatch = full-service replacement opportunity.

signals.structural_force: Employment services (NAICS 5613) has 3.57M employees across 156K establishments -- massive labor market, employment declining -7.6%
signals.headline: Staffing/employment services: 156K establishments, $54K avg pay, employment DECLINING 7.6%, AI recruiting disrupting
signals.detail: NAICS 5613 (Employment services -- temp agencies, staffing, PEOs) shows 3,567,509 employees across 155,963 establishments. Employment declining sharply (-7.6%). Average pay $54,002. AI-driven recruiting, matching, and scheduling are compressing the staffing industry's labor-intensive model. This is a pre-cascade signal: the industry employing 3.5M people is contracting while AI alternatives emerge.

signals.structural_force: Nursing care facilities (NAICS 6231) have 1.42M employees across 20K establishments -- severe workforce crisis, AI monitoring opportunity
signals.headline: Skilled nursing: 19,888 establishments, $47K avg pay, massive workforce, AI clinical monitoring
signals.detail: NAICS 6231 (Nursing care facilities / skilled nursing facilities) shows 1,418,010 employees across 19,888 establishments. Average pay $47,034. Severe workforce shortage combined with growing elderly population. AI can handle medication management, fall detection, clinical documentation, and remote monitoring -- extending the capacity of existing staff rather than replacing them.

signals.structural_force: Child care services (NAICS 6244) have 955K employees across 78K establishments -- severe shortage, $32K avg pay, deepest Baumol target at low-wage end
signals.headline: Child care: 78,107 establishments, $32K avg pay, extreme low-wage Baumol, AI admin tools
signals.detail: NAICS 6244 (Child care services) shows 954,796 employees across 78,107 establishments. Average pay $31,747 -- among the lowest-paid large industries. Classic low-wage Baumol: costs rising but wages can't keep up. AI can automate enrollment, billing, communication, curriculum planning, and regulatory compliance -- freeing staff time for actual care.

signals.structural_force: Continuing care/assisted living (NAICS 6233) has 944K employees across 29K establishments -- growing elderly demand, $38K avg pay
signals.headline: Assisted living: 28,786 establishments, $38K avg pay, low-wage Baumol with growing demand
signals.detail: NAICS 6233 (Continuing care retirement communities and assisted living) shows 943,776 employees across 28,786 establishments. Average pay $38,417. Growing elderly population drives demand. AI can handle care coordination, medication reminders, family communication, and compliance documentation. Many small facilities with succession planning challenges.

signals.structural_force: Offices of physicians (NAICS 6211) have 2.9M employees across 235K establishments -- the largest healthcare sector by employment
signals.headline: Physician offices: 235K establishments, $107K avg pay, 2.8% wage growth, 3.2% employment growth
signals.detail: NAICS 6211 (Offices of physicians) shows 2,896,308 employees across 234,765 establishments. Average pay $106,792 with 2.8% wage growth. Employment growing 3.2%. $309.3B total wage base -- the single largest addressable market in healthcare. Prior auth, billing, scheduling, clinical documentation -- all automatable functions for independent practices.

signals.structural_force: Dairy product manufacturing (NAICS 3115) has 165K employees across 2,636 establishments -- moderate fragmentation, precision processing
signals.headline: Dairy manufacturing: 2,636 establishments, $70K avg pay, automated process control opportunity
signals.detail: NAICS 3115 (Dairy product manufacturing) shows 164,865 employees across 2,636 establishments. Average pay $70,030. Includes fluid milk, cheese, ice cream, dried milk products. AI-driven precision temperature control, yield optimization, and predictive maintenance for refrigeration systems. FSMA compliance creates moat.

signals.structural_force: Animal slaughtering/processing (NAICS 3116) has 546K employees across 4,560 establishments -- large workforce, $53K avg pay, automation ROI high
signals.headline: Meat processing: 4,560 establishments, $53K avg pay, high labor intensity, robotic cutting/packing emerging
signals.detail: NAICS 3116 (Animal slaughtering and processing) shows 545,882 employees across 4,560 establishments. Average pay $53,036. Very labor-intensive with high injury rates. AI vision for grading, robotic deboning, automated portioning, and AI-driven food safety monitoring. USDA inspection integration = regulatory moat.

signals.structural_force: Household/institutional furniture manufacturing (NAICS 3371) has 227K employees across 12,767 establishments -- fragmented, custom production
signals.headline: Furniture manufacturing: 12,767 establishments, $52K avg pay, high fragmentation, custom production AI fit
signals.detail: NAICS 3371 (Household and institutional furniture) shows 226,685 employees across 12,767 establishments. Average pay $52,232. Includes kitchen cabinets -- a high-demand custom fabrication sector. AI-driven design-to-production workflows, CNC routing optimization, and robotic assembly. Many small shops with retiring owners.

signals.structural_force: Residential building construction (NAICS 2361) has 926K employees across 226K establishments -- massive fragmentation, growing establishment count
signals.headline: Residential construction: 226K establishments, $73K avg pay, frag 0.244, AI project management
signals.detail: NAICS 2361 (Residential building construction) shows 926,429 employees across 226,436 establishments. Very high fragmentation (0.244). Average pay $73,065 with 4.4% wage growth. Many small builders. AI can automate scheduling, permitting, subcontractor management, estimating, and project tracking. Growing establishment count confirms Coasean shrinkage.

signals.structural_force: Individual/family services (NAICS 6241) has 2.95M employees across 981K establishments -- the MOST fragmented major industry, $32K avg pay
signals.headline: Individual/family services: 981K establishments, $32K avg pay, baumol 0.43, EXTREME fragmentation
signals.detail: NAICS 6241 (Individual and family services) shows 2,953,256 employees across 981,038 establishments -- the highest establishment count of any 4-digit NAICS code. Fragmentation proxy 0.332. Average pay only $31,573. Includes home care aides, personal care services, elder support. While baumol score is low (0.43), the sheer SIZE and fragmentation create platform infrastructure opportunity.

signals.structural_force: Computer systems design (NAICS 5415) has 2.46M employees across 406K establishments -- baumol 2.05, AI eating its own output
signals.headline: IT services/consulting: 406K establishments, $149K avg pay, 5.0% wage growth, AI self-disruption
signals.detail: NAICS 5415 (Computer systems design and related services) shows 2,460,334 employees across 405,625 establishments. Baumol score 2.05. Average pay $149,102 with 5.0% wage growth but declining employment (-0.4%). $366.8B total wage base. This is AI eating its own output: the IT services sector that BUILDS technology is being disrupted by AI code generation, automated testing, and AI architecture design.

signals.structural_force: Building finishing contractors (NAICS 2383) have 836K employees across 138K establishments -- painting, drywall, flooring, Silver Tsunami
signals.headline: Building finishing: 138K establishments, $63K avg pay, high fragmentation, 4.9% wage growth
signals.detail: NAICS 2383 (Building finishing contractors -- painting, drywall, tile, flooring) shows 835,690 employees across 138,015 establishments. Fragmentation proxy 0.165. Average pay $62,702 with 4.9% wage growth. Nearly flat employment. Many small operations with aging owners. AI can optimize scheduling, estimating, material ordering; robotic drywall finishing emerging.

signals.structural_force: Outpatient care centers (NAICS 6214) have 1.07M employees across 50K establishments -- growing healthcare delivery model, $79K avg pay
signals.headline: Outpatient care: 49,654 establishments, $79K avg pay, fastest growing healthcare delivery model
signals.detail: NAICS 6214 (Outpatient care centers) shows 1,070,974 employees across 49,654 establishments. Average pay $79,088. Includes substance abuse clinics, family planning, kidney dialysis, urgent care, ambulatory surgery. Growing faster than hospitals. AI can manage scheduling, billing, prior auth, and clinical documentation across multi-site networks.

signals.structural_force: HVAC/commercial refrigeration equipment manufacturing (NAICS 3334) has 144K employees across 2,834 establishments -- AI data center cooling demand
signals.headline: HVAC equipment manufacturing: 2,834 establishments, $69K avg pay, AI data center thermal demand spike
signals.detail: NAICS 3334 shows 144,266 employees across 2,834 establishments. Average pay $69,076. AI data center demand driving need for sophisticated liquid cooling systems -- 40-50kW server racks require advanced thermal management. Manufacturing these systems with AI-optimized production = compound opportunity (AI builds the systems that cool AI).

signals.structural_force: Real estate agents/brokers (NAICS 5312) have 356K employees across 163K establishments -- employment declining -5.2%, highest fragmentation in services
signals.headline: Real estate agents: 163K establishments, $85K avg pay, employment DECLINING 5.2%, extremely fragmented
signals.detail: NAICS 5312 shows 355,726 employees across 162,685 establishments. Fragmentation proxy 0.457 -- among the highest in the economy. Employment declining sharply (-5.2%). Average pay declining (-3.4%). This sector is in active cascade: NAR settlement, technology disruption, changing buyer behavior. Baumol score 1.17. Despite cycle 6 dismissal of real estate AI at enterprise level, the brokerage OPERATIONS layer (transaction coordination, document management, compliance) may be viable.

signals.structural_force: Other fabricated metal products (NAICS 3329) have 278K employees across 8,758 establishments -- broad metal fab sector
signals.headline: Fabricated metal products: 8,758 establishments, $77K avg pay, diverse metal fabrication
signals.detail: NAICS 3329 shows 278,046 employees across 8,758 establishments. Average pay $77,431. Includes powder metallurgy, ball/roller bearings, ammunition, industrial fasteners, and misc metal fabrication. Many small shops with specialized capabilities. AI-driven quality control, toolpath optimization, and predictive maintenance apply broadly.

signals.structural_force: Wholesale trade agents/brokers (NAICS 4251) have 512K employees across 122K establishments -- intermediaries vulnerable to AI disintermediation
signals.headline: Wholesale brokers: 122K establishments, $126K avg pay, declining employment, AI disintermediation
signals.detail: NAICS 4251 shows 511,666 employees across 122,460 establishments. Average pay $125,899 with declining employment (-1.0%). High fragmentation (0.239). These are intermediaries connecting manufacturers to retailers -- classic Coasean target. AI-powered matchmaking, logistics optimization, and automated ordering threaten the broker model.

signals.structural_force: Ag machinery/construction machinery manufacturing (NAICS 3331) has 220K employees -- robotics x AI in equipment manufacturing
signals.headline: Ag/construction machinery: 4,711 establishments, $86K avg pay, AI-enabled equipment emerging
signals.detail: NAICS 3331 shows 220,086 employees across 4,711 establishments. Average pay $86,493. Includes farm machinery, lawn/garden equipment, construction equipment, mining machinery. The equipment itself is being AI-enabled (See & Spray, autonomous tractors). Manufacturing these AI-enhanced machines with AI-optimized production = compounding play.

signals.structural_force: Motor vehicle parts manufacturing (NAICS 3363) has 560K employees across 6,343 establishments -- supply chain pressure driving AI adoption
signals.headline: Auto parts manufacturing: 6,343 establishments, $70K avg pay, quality + supply chain AI
signals.detail: NAICS 3363 shows 559,578 employees across 6,343 establishments. Average pay $69,898. OEM quality requirements + supply chain disruption creating urgency for AI adoption in defect detection, scheduling optimization, and predictive maintenance. Many Tier 2/3 suppliers are small shops ripe for modernization.

signals.structural_force: Nondepository credit intermediation (NAICS 5222) has 533K employees across 53K establishments -- mortgage/consumer lenders, employment declining -9.8%
signals.headline: Mortgage/consumer lending: 53K establishments, $116K avg pay, employment DECLINING 9.8%
signals.detail: NAICS 5222 shows 532,831 employees across 53,288 establishments. Employment declining sharply (-9.8%). Baumol score 1.59. This is an ACTIVE CASCADE: mortgage lending employment collapsing as rates remain high and AI underwriting automates processes. The surviving firms will be AI-native. Platform infrastructure for surviving lenders = opportunity.

signals.structural_force: Activities related to credit intermediation (NAICS 5223) has 290K employees with employment declining -10.7% -- loan servicing/processing in active collapse
signals.headline: Credit support activities: employment DECLINING 10.7%, 13.8% wage growth -- classic Schumpeterian gap
signals.detail: NAICS 5223 shows 290,483 employees with employment declining -10.7% but wages growing 13.8%. This is a textbook Schumpeterian gap signal: the workers being retained are being paid more while headcount drops dramatically. AI loan processing, servicing, and collections are automating the routine cognitive work.

signals.structural_force: Office administrative services (NAICS 5611) have 612K employees across 78K establishments -- back-office operations ripe for AI full-service replacement
signals.headline: Office admin services: 78K establishments, $104K avg pay, 2.8% wage growth, AI back-office
signals.detail: NAICS 5611 shows 611,619 employees across 78,433 establishments. Average pay $104,261 with 2.8% wage growth. Baumol score 1.44. These are outsourced back-office services -- exactly what AI agents can replace. Full-service replacement architecture applies directly: replace the outsourced human team with an AI team.

signals.structural_force: Soap/cleaning compound/cosmetics manufacturing (NAICS 3256) has 114K employees across 3,915 establishments -- DTC beauty/personal care boom
signals.headline: Cosmetics/cleaning mfg: 3,915 establishments, $83K avg pay, DTC brand + AI production
signals.detail: NAICS 3256 shows 114,411 employees across 3,915 establishments. Average pay $82,705. Includes cosmetics, personal care products, and cleaning supplies. DTC brand proliferation creating demand for contract manufacturing. AI-driven formulation optimization, batch scheduling, and quality control. FDA regulatory compliance = moat.

signals.structural_force: Sugar/confectionery manufacturing (NAICS 3113) has 81K employees across 2,304 establishments -- specialty candy/confectionery Silver Tsunami
signals.headline: Confectionery: 2,304 establishments, $63K avg pay, specialty candy acquisition targets
signals.detail: NAICS 3113 shows 81,305 employees across 2,304 establishments. Average pay $63,333. Includes candy, chocolate, chewing gum, confections. Many multigenerational family businesses with succession gaps. AI can optimize tempering, molding, packaging, and distribution. FSMA compliance + brand equity = acquisition moat.
